title: Helen Mirren, 74, looks radiant as she departs Catherine the Great screening in New York City
text:
She's one of Hollywood's most respected actresses.

And Helen Mirren looked every inch the film star as she left an advanced screening of Catherine the Great followed by a talk for the New Yorker Festival at the New York Institute of Technology in New York City on Tuesday.

The Winchester star, 74, cut a stylish figure as she left the event, donning a white sheer top with flared sleeves and a floral detail.

Style: Helen Mirren looked every inch the film star as she left an advanced screening of Catherine the Great in New York City on Tuesday

The garment also featured a matching white ribbon while Helen paired it with high-waisted black trousers.

Adding height to her frame with a pair of heels, Helen completed her look with hoop earrings and a black handbag.

Helen's latest role is in Catherine the Great where she plays the titular character during her reign as Empress of Russia.

The four-part drama will chart the latter years of Catherine’s 34-year reign and was filmed in Russia, Latvia and Lithuania.

Fashion: The Winchester star cut a stylish figure as she left the event, donning a white sheer top with flared sleeves and a floral detail

Outfit: The garment also featured a matching white ribbon while Helen paired it with high-waisted black trousers as she posed with a fan

Following the assassination of her husband Emperor Peter III in 1762, Catherine was rumoured to have had a string of male lovers and children through illicit affairs.

The series will particularly focus on Catherine's relationship with Russian statesman Grigory, who is played by Terminator Genisys star Jason Clarke.

It will be Helen's first major television role for 13 years, having last played Queen Elizabeth I in a Channel 4 miniseries.

Speaking to the Daily Mail's Baz Bamigboye, Helen gave an insight into her love life while speaking about her role in the show.

‘I’ve had probably three or four serious lovers. I was serially monogamous until I met my husband. And now I’m just monogamous,’ said the star, whose lovers included Liam Neeson, before she married the ‘love of my life’ director Taylor Hackford 22 years ago.
